explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing fluorine and chlorine (but not oxygen), with the fluorine and chlorine bound to carbon and hydrogen respectively (but not to other elements)

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to gaseous substances are not available (boiling point: 32degC (Lide, 84th, 2003), test temperature: 55degC)

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of >5,000mg/kg (SIDS (2003)).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the LD50 (dermal route) values of >2,000mg/kg (rats) and >2,000mg/kg (rabbits) (SIDS (2003)), obtained in accordance with TG402, and no marked toxic symptoms observed.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "liquid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Based on the rat LC50 value of 62,100ppm (4 hours), calculated from the testing data of rat LC50 (inhalation of vapour) of 297.6mg/L (4 hours) (SIDS (2003)), 295mg/L (4 hours) (EHC 139 (1992)) and 300.7mg/L (4 hours) (ECETOC JACC 15 (1990)), was lower than 90% of the saturated vapour concentration (763,000ppm) under a saturated vapour pressure of 76.3kPa (25degC) (SIDS (2003)), the substance was considered as "vapour containing substantially no mist" and was classified based on standard values expressed in ppm.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the results of rabbit skin irritation tests, SIDS (2003) concludes "it is not irritating to the skin." The substance is thus considered non skin irritant.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: SIDS (2003) evaluating eye irritation potential of 1,1-dichloro-1-fluoroethane in rats provides two sets of data: one positive ("mild irritation (conjunctivitis, chemosis, and moderate blood-tinged discharge) with no corneal involvement. All treated eyes of all rabbits were normal by 72 hours after treatment") and one negative. SIDS (2003) concludes "it is only mildly irritating to the eye." The substance is thus considered a mild irritant and placed in Category 2B.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: SIDS (2003) evaluating skin sensitizing potential of 1,1-dichloro-1-fluoro in guinea pigs concludes "it is not a skin sensitization in the Guinea pig." However, classification is not possible because of the insufficiency of data to determine the presence of sensitization.

carcinogenicity.rationale: Based on the absence of data on multi-generation mutagenicity tests and germ cell mutagenicity tests in vivo, and negative data on somatic cell mutagenicity tests in vivo (micronucleus tests), described in SIDS (2003) and EHC 139 (1992).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the unborn child
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence of adverse effects on reproduction and development (including declined fertility and decreased postimplantation loss) at dosing levels toxic to parental animals.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause drowsiness or dizziness (narcotic effects)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including: "dose level (concentration) producing narcotic effects on 50% of test animals: 62g/m3" (EHC 139 (1992)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 3.

aspiration_hazard.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 3 from 48 hours LC50=31mg/L of the crustacea (Daphnia magna) (ECETOC TR91, 2003).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Harmful to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although acute toxicity was Category 3 and the bio-accumulation potential was low (log Kow=2.37(PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), since there was no rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 2-10%(EHC139, 1992)), it was classified into Category 3.
